children.title: About
children.content:
Apache Spark is a unified analytics engine for large-scale data processing. (Cluster computing platform)
At its core, Spark is a “computational engine” that is responsible for scheduling, distributing, and monitoring applications consisting of many computational tasks across many worker machines, or a computing cluster. 
If Hadoop MapReduce was the "first generation" of big data processing, Spark is the "second generation"—built for speed, ease of use, and versatility.

Features
Easy to use: we can develop applications, using a high-level API that let us focus on the content of our computation
Speed: It is up to 100x faster than Hadoop MapReduce because it processes data in-memory (RAM) rather than writing to the disk after every step.
Lazy Evaluation: Spark doesn't execute your code immediately. It builds a plan (called a DAG or Directed Acyclic Graph) and only runs it when you finally ask for a result. This allows it to optimize the entire process first.
As general engine: letting you combine multiple types of computations (e.g., SQL queries, text process‐ing, and machine learning) that might previously have required different engines.

Polyglot: You can write Spark code in Python (PySpark), Scala, Java, or R.
